intro: Dalechampia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Dalechampia amazonica is often found in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the rich, nutrient-dense soils of the Amazon basin.
